data.enText: formal permission given by a company to sb who wants to sell its goods or services in a particular area; formal permission given by a government to sb who wants to operate a public service as a business
data.chText: （公司授予的）特许经销权；（国家授予的）特别经营权，特许
特许经销权协议；特约代销公司

data.enText: In the reorganization, Southern Television lost their franchise.
data.chText: 在改组过程中南方电视公司失去了特许经营权。

data.enText: to operate a business under franchise
a business or service run under franchise
data.chText: 获特许权的商业（或服务）机构

data.enText: They operate franchises in London and Paris.
data.chText: 他们在伦敦和巴黎经营专卖店。

data.enText: the right to vote in a country's elections
to give or sell a franchise(1) to sb
data.chText: 授予（或出售）特许经销权（或经营权）

data.enText: Catering has been franchised (out) to a private company.
data.chText: 餐饮特许经营权已授予一家私人公司。

means: (国家授予的)特别经营权，特许
获特许权的商业(或服务)机构
授予(或出售)特许经销权(或经营权)

tr: a statutory right or privilege granted to a person or group by a government (especially the rights of citizenship and the right to vote)
an authorization to sell a company's goods or services in a particular place
a business established or operated under an authorization to sell or distribute a company's goods or services in a particular area

example.ex: ...the franchise to build and operate the tunnel...
example.tran: 建造和经营隧道的特许权

example.ex: Talk to other franchise holders and ask them what they think of the parent company.
example.tran: 和其他特许经营者谈一谈，问问他们对母公司是什么看法。

gramarinfo.label: oft n N, N <l>to</l> n, N n

value.def: A franchise is an authority that is given by an organization to someone, allowing them to sell its goods or services or to take part in an activity which the organization controls.
value.tran: 特许经营权;专卖权;经销权

example.ex: She has recently franchised her business...
example.tran: 她最近向其他公司出售了公司业务的特许经营权。

example.ex: Though the service is available only in California, its founder Michael Cane says he plans to franchise it in other states...
example.tran: 尽管只有在加利福尼亚才有这项服务，其创立者迈克尔·凯恩表示计划在其他州出售特许经营权。

example.ex: It takes hundreds of thousands of dollars to get into the franchised pizza business.
example.tran: 要想得到比萨店的特许经营权，需要支付一大笔钱。

value.def: If a company franchises its business, it sells franchises to other companies, allowing them to sell its goods or services.

example.ex: One of the most important aspects of franchising is the reduced risk of business failure it offers to franchisees.
example.tran: 特许经营最重要的一个特点就是它会降低受许人经营失败的风险。

example.ex: The 1867 Reform Act extended the franchise to much of the male working class.
example.tran: 《1867 年改革法》扩大了选举权的范围，使多数男性工人都拥有了该权利。

value.def: Franchise is the right to vote in an election, especially one in which people elect a parliament.
